ChestLVSeatedDeclineFly.name: Lever Seated Decline Fly (gripless)
ChestLVSeatedDeclineFly.preparation: Sit on seat with back against seat. Position both arms over back of padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders, wrists are slightly lower than elbows.
ChestLVSeatedDeclineFly.execution: Bring padded levers together by pushing pads forward and downward in hugging motion. Return to starting position until chests muscle are stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVSeatedDeclineFly.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing back at beginning of motion and outward at end of motion.

ChestLVChestDip2.name: Lever Chest Dip
ChestLVChestDip2.preparation: If possible, place handles in wide position. Sit on seat with legs under pads. Grasp handles with oblique grip. Lean slightly forward and allow elbows to flare out.
ChestLVChestDip2.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVChestDip2.comments: See alternative machine. Also see Lever Chest Dip on machine facing away from fulcrum and Lever Triceps Dip.
ChestLVChestDip2.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

ChestLVChestDip.name: Lever Chest Dip
ChestLVChestDip.preparation: If possible, place handles in wide position. Sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. Lean forward slightly and allow elbows to flare out.
ChestLVChestDip.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVChestDip.comments: See Lever Chest Dip on machine facing fulcrum. Also see Lever Triceps Dip.
ChestLVChestDip.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

ChestLVBenchPress.name: Lever Bench Press
ChestLVBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on bench with chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
ChestLVBenchPress.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to upp er chest. Repeat.
ChestLVBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVChestPress.name: Lever Chest Press
ChestLVChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of horizontal handles. If available, push foot lever until lever is within grasping range. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip elbows out to sides just below shoulders. Release foot lever.
ChestLVChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVChestPress.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips. Also see exercises on machine with lever fulcrum above. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVLyingFly.name: Lever Lying Fly
ChestLVLyingFly.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Position both arms under padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
ChestLVLyingFly.execution: Bring padded levers upward and together in hugging motion. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVLyingFly.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing downward at bottom of motion and outward at top of motion.

ChestLVDeclineBenchPress.name: Lever Decline Bench Press
ChestLVDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie supine on decline bench with feet under leg brace and chest under lever bar. Grasp lever bar with wide oblique overhand grip.
ChestLVDeclineBenchPress.execution: Press bar until arms are extended. Lower weight to chest. Repeat.
ChestLVDeclineBenchPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVParallelGripChestPress.name: Lever Parallel Grip Chest Press
ChestLVParallelGripChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with sides of ribs approximately height of parallel handles. If available, push foot lever until handles are within grasping range. Grasp parallel handles. Release foot lever.
ChestLVParallelGripChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until shoulders or chest feels slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVParallelGripChestPress.comments: Some machines have foot levers to position handles in a more comfortable starting and ending position. If foot lever is available, engage it before grasping handles, release it before performing exercise, and engage it again just before releasing grips. Seat should be adjusted so handles are to sides of ribs. Parallel grip tends to place shoulders in a more stable position, with arms closer to sides, which may be more ideal for those with certain shoulder issues. See exercise performed on alternative apparatus with lever from bottom of machine. Also see exercise performed with standard grip providing greater emphasis on chest development . Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVSeatedIronCrossFly.name: Lever Seated Iron Cross Fly
ChestLVSeatedIronCrossFly.preparation: Straddle seat with both levers positioned slightly above horizontal. Grasp both lever ends with elbows slightly above levers. Sit down near end of seat with torso leaning forward slightly and slightly bent elbows pointing back.
ChestLVSeatedIronCrossFly.execution: Push levers downward and together in hugging motion. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed slightly upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVSeatedIronCrossFly.comments: Under greater resistance, positioning torso at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips), will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of cables, as opposed to stepping forward and struggling with the backward pull of cables. Also see Bentover Fly on Standing Iron Cross Machine.

ChestLVPecDeckFly.name: Lever Pec Deck Fly
ChestLVPecDeckFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. If available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. Place forearms on padded lever. Position upper arms approximately parallel. Release foot lever.
ChestLVPecDeckFly.execution: Push levers together. Return until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.

ChestLVBentoverFlyIronCross.name: Lever Bent-over Fly (on iron cross machine)
ChestLVBentoverFlyIronCross.preparation: Stand on platform in front of Lever Iron Cross Machine. Grasp handles to each side. Bend over at hips with knees and elbows bent slightly. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointing upward.
ChestLVBentoverFlyIronCross.execution: Bring lever handles together in hugging motion with elbows in fixed position. Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows are pointed upward at top and out to sides at bottom. Return to starting position until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVBentoverFlyIronCross.comments: Height of platform should allow shoulders to be near the same height of fulcrums. Secondary levers compensate somewhat for variations if alignment between points of rotation (lever fulcrum and shoulder girdle articulation). Under greater resistance, height of platform can be increased so torso can be positioned at lower angle downward (by bending over at hips). This will allow upper body weight to counterbalance upward pull of levers. See Lever Seated Iron Cross Fly and Lever Iron Cross for Lats.
ChestLVBentoverFlyIronCross.stabilizers: brachialis, tricepsbrachii, wristflexors, rectusabdominis, bicepsbrachii, obliques

ChestLVSeatedFly2.name: Lever Seated Fly
ChestLVSeatedFly2.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. Grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
ChestLVSeatedFly2.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. Return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
ChestLVSeatedFly2.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. Adjust lever arms on machine so slight stretch is felt when weight is lowered. Also see exercises on alternative machine.

ChestLVAlternatingChestPress.name: Lever Alternating Chest Press
ChestLVAlternatingChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
ChestLVAlternatingChestPress.execution: Press one lever until arm is extended. Return lever back until chest muscle is slightly stretched. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
ChestLVAlternatingChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

ChestLVSeatedFly.name: Lever Seated Fly
ChestLVSeatedFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. Grasp handles to both sides, shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are back.
ChestLVSeatedFly.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, push lever handles forward and together. Return to back toward original position until mild stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
ChestLVSeatedFly.comments: Shoulders are kept internally rotated so elbows are pointing out to sides. The starting position of levers can be adjusted on many apparatuses, allowing for both rear delt and chest to be exercised. Exercise can be performed on Lever Rear Delt machine even if levers do not adjust to wide starting position. Also see exercises on alternative machine.

ChestLVSeatedFlyGripless.name: Lever Seated Fly (gripless)
ChestLVSeatedFlyGripless.preparation: Sit on seat with back against pad and feet on foot bar. Position both arms behind padded levers. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are pointed back.
ChestLVSeatedFlyGripless.execution: Bring padded levers forward and together in hugging motion. Return to starting position until stretch in chests or shoulder is felt. Repeat.
ChestLVSeatedFlyGripless.comments: Shoulders should be internally rotated so elbows are pointing backwards at beginning of motion and forward at completion of motion.

ChestLVDeclineChestPress.name: Lever Decline Chest Press
ChestLVDeclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
ChestLVDeclineChestPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVDeclineChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Latissimus Dorsi involvement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVChestPressS.name: Lever Chest Press
ChestLVChestPressS.preparation: Sit on seat with chest approximately height of handles. Grasp handles with wide overhand grip elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
ChestLVChestPressS.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until chest muscles are slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVChestPressS.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see exercise performed with parallel grip. Also see Bench Press Analysis.

ChestLVAlternatingDeclineChestPress.name: Lever Alternating Decline Chest Press
ChestLVAlternatingDeclineChestPress.preparation: Sit on seat with lever grips lower chest height. Grasp grips with wide overhand grip elbows out to sides just below shoulders.
ChestLVAlternatingDeclineChestPress.execution: Press one lever until arm is extended. Return lever back until chest muscle is slightly stretched. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
ChestLVAlternatingDeclineChestPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

ChestLVDeclineFly.name: Lever Decline Pec Deck Fly
ChestLVDeclineFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back on pad. If available, push foot lever until padded lever moves forward. Place forearms on padded lever. Position upper arms approximately parallel. Release foot lever.
ChestLVDeclineFly.execution: Push levers together. Return until chest muscles are stretched. Repeat.

ChestLVChestDip.name: Lever Chest Dip
ChestLVChestDip.preparation: If possible, place handles in wide position. Sit on seat and grasp handles with oblique grip. Lean forward slightly and allow elbows to flare out.
ChestLVChestDip.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestLVChestDip.comments: See Lever Chest Dip on machine facing fulcrum. Also see Lever Triceps Dip.
ChestLVChestDip.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, pectoralisminor, rhomboids
